resources.name: Tricks on Simple Interest - BYJU'S Exam Prep
resources.description: This resource discusses the basic questions that are usually asked about Simple Interest and how you can solve them using the normal as well as Shortcut approach.

resources.name: Simple Interest Formula - The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This resource is a video that walks you through some example problems using the Simple Interest formula. He talks about the thought process while solving these questions.

resources.name: Math with Mr. J
resources.author: Math with Mr. J
resources.description: This YouTube channel works through many different topics covered in this class, from graphing to geometry to basic algebra. If you are struggling with a topic, this channel most likely has a video covering it or something similar to it.

resources.name: Introduction to Number Theory - Bullis Student Tutors
resources.author: Bullis Student Tutors
resources.description: This video serves as a great overview to number theory, which is one of the main topics covered in MA 110. It also provides a few real world examples where number theory can be applied!!

resources.name: Algebra Basics: Graphing On The Coordinate Plane - Math Antics
resources.author: Math Antics
resources.description: This video is a great introduction to graphing different points on a cartesian plane. He uses a very easy strategy and makes it simple to understand!!

resources.name: Intro to rational & irrational numbers - Khan Academy
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This video discusses the difference between rational and irrational numbers, and how you can easily distinguish between the two.

resources.name: Introduction to Geometry - The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: Covers almost every single topic you will need to know related to geometry, and gives examples of how those concepts apply to different problems. Terrific video if struggling with geometric concepts.

resources.name: Introduction to Probability, Basic Overview - Sample Space, & Tree Diagrams - The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.author: The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This is a great introduction video when first learning about probability. The video maps the concepts out very clearly and works slowly to help you get a grasp on this new idea.

resources.name: Laws of sines and cosines - Khan Academy
resources.description: This resource helps students understand the law of sin and cos by explaining how to do them and going through different examples.

resources.name: Graphing Logarithmic Functions - Varsity Tutors
resources.description: This resource describes how to graph log functions. It has interactive examples to help students understand each part of the function and how it translates onto the graph.

resources.name: Shifting, Stretching and Reflecting Parent Function Graphs
resources.description: This video goes through and explains all of the different types of transformations; shifting, stretching, and reflection. It is a shorter video and it does a really good job explaining each transformation.

resources.name: Discrete Probability Distribution - Cuemath
resources.author: Cuemath
resources.description: This source gives a helpful insight to discrete distributions, some of the different types, examples and definitions can be found here!

resources.name: Continuous Probability Distribution - Statistics How To
resources.author: Statistics How To
resources.description: This source gives a definition of continuous distributions, the different types, and a comparison between discrete and continuous distributions.

resources.name: The Central Limit Theorem, Clearly Explained!!! - StatQuest with Josh Starmer
resources.author: StatQuest with Josh Starmer
resources.description: This youtube video gives a clear explanation of the central limit theorem!

resources.name: [name]
resources.description: description

resources.name: Absolute minima & maxima (entire domain) - Khan Academy
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: This link is to a video on Khan Academy that demonstrates how to evaluate max and min in calculus. I put this on there because when I was first learning calculus, this was an area I struggled with. I hope the video helps!

resources.name: Derivative Calculator - Symbolab
resources.author: Symbolab
resources.description: Nothing was more reassuring than knowing if I solved a difficult derivative for a group homework assignment or online homework. This link takes you to a derivative calculator that should solve any equation you plug into it. It is a great way to check to see if you were right and to clean up any tiny mistakes you might make.

resources.name: Implicit Differentiation - Professor Dave Explains
resources.author: Professor Dave Explains
resources.description: The last helpful link I have for this class is over implicit differentiation. I wanted to put this on here because he explains the lesson well and it can really help you when getting into related rates which is usually taught right after implicit differentiation. I hope this video makes sense.

resources.name: Calculus Video Playlist - The Organic Chemistry Tutor
resources.description: This resource has many trusted videos that go through explanations and example problems for many integral things as well as taylor series! Videos 127-256 are most relevant to MA 252.

resources.name: Integral Calculus - Khan Academy
resources.description: Khan Academy has 5 units on integral calculus with videos and practice problems for each section covered within MA 252

resources.name: Integral Calculator - Wolfram|Alpha
resources.description: This source can be used to check your answers for integrations, as well as showing a graph of the integral.

resources.name: Desmos Graphing Calculator
resources.description: If you go to the graphing calculator and click the three lines in the upper left corner of the page, you can pull up example graphs that have polar coordinates, integrals, and taylor series. This can be a great resource to help someone see these concepts on a graph and you can interact with the settings of them to see how they change as you manipulate them.

resources.name: Paul's Online Notes
resources.author: Paul Dawkins
resources.description: Includes helpful notes about Calculus 1-3. Dr. Becker and the Birgens all recommend reviewing some Calc 1 & 2 materials as a way for studying for this course as well. It includes practice problems and written notes

resources.name: Multivariable Calculus - Khan Academy
resources.author: Khan Academy
resources.description: Khan Academy: Enough said.

resources.name: Essence of calculus - 3Blue1Brown
resources.author: 3Blue1Brown
resources.description: Decent resource for Calculus. It is maybe a bit high level, but I appreciate the animations and being able to see some of the different stuff. There is another playlist for Linear Algebra of someone is doing that course that is probably better than the calc one

resources.name: Other Multivariable Calculus Websites & Resources - Monroe Community College
resources.author: Monroe Community College
resources.description: Just a list of other resources at Monroe's website. Control F to search the topic you are looking for.

resources.name: W3Schools (no)
resources.description: This is a website with helpful explanations and tutorials of Python programming concepts.
